page.title: 07Chew Stoke School
page.content: Chew Stoke School was founded in the 17th Century. The pupils have a summer festival every year. They have one theme for this festival and each class do different scenes from it. The school building itself is very old, but newer bits have been added on. The head-mistress of this school is at the moment Mrs Z.E.Wilson. There are about one hundred and twenty pupils at this school. The school has an old bell on the top of it, it does not work any more though. At this school they also have a Christmas play but it is not outside like the summer one but inside in the hall.
